author: Staff Reporter
text:
The heart of a 55-year-old man, who was declared brain dead at Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore, was harvested and taken for transplant to a private hospital in Chennai during the early hours of Sunday.

CMC authorities said Subramani, a resident of Thandrampet in Tiruvannamalai district, met with an accident on February 26. A two-wheeler had knocked him down and he sustained a head injury. He was rushed to the Government Tiruvannamalai Medical College Hospital and then shifted to CMC.

“He was declared brain on February 27 at CMC. He has three daughters and a son. His family consented to donate his organs,” a hospital authority said.

His heart was allocated to Frontier Lifeline Hospital, Chennai, while his liver and two kidneys were allotted for CMC Hospital. He added that the heart was transported to the Chennai hospital in an ambulance.

“The medical team left CMC with the heart at about 5.30 a.m. in the ambulance. It was escorted by police,” he said. – Staff Reporter
title: Heart of brain dead person harvested
